TopicTitle: How do I view a successful mission log?

Articles.Content: Pretty obvious from the title. I can see mission logs, with timelines and statistics of the flight, immediately after crashing a flight, but they do not appear after a successful landing and recovery. How can I review my previous flights?

I don't think you can look at a mission log from one that you already ended/recovered, but while in-flight you can always check the updated log by pressing alt+F3.(right shift on linux, don't know for mac)

There's one thing that would be really usefu for my fanwork mission report:

Is it possible to export detailed mission logs to text file?

I have already tried searching for mods that can do something similar to this, but I haven't been successful yet.. (maybe because there are none?)
Just F3 (no shifts or alts) works for me.

I'm not sure how "connect" threads in the forum (or even if that can be done at the user lever) but, in the interest of networking mavens who are thinking along similar lines I've included links to other threads having to do with a "Mission Log" or a "Mission Planner" mod suggestion/request.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/28096-Mission-Log-Mod?highlight=mission+log

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/72723-A-Mission-Log-Mod-Completely-New-to-Modding?highlight=mission+log

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/63104-How-do-I-view-a-successful-mission-log?highlight=mission+log

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/72358-Mission-Log?highlight=mission+log

I started develop a mod that will log the missions. It is my first experience on KSP mod development, so, please don't judge. I have an alpha version of the mode that is available of on github.

I hope that will help.
